question: Why do you swab the floors?
answer: We swab floors to pick up any SARS-CoV-2 RNA (the genetic material of the virus) that we can then detect using laboratory-based genetic methods. The aim of our study is to develop this technique as a means to monitor the presence of SARS-CoV-2 in congregate settings (e.g. schools, daycares, long-term care homes, workplaces, etc.).

question: How long will you be swabbing our facilities?
answer: Most facilities are swabbed on a weekly basis for a number of months.

question: When will we hear about the results?
answer: The results will be made publicly available when the study is complete.

question: Can you get Covid-19 from the floor? Should we be cleaning our floors more often?
answer: The current scientific consensus is that Covid-19 is mainly transmitted through aerosols. It is highly unlikely for an individual to become infected by Covid-19 directly from floors, but floors may have some viable virus present.
